title: HOW THE FUCK DO I TURN OFF THE DUMB MOUSEOVER NOISES AND STILL GET QUEUE SOUND

replies.body: Which sounds do you mean?  Like the bell noises when mousing over champions in your collection?  You can disable this by muting or unchecking "Enable SFX" in your client settings, under the sound panel.  Let me know if that helps.

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=jJrAfj8t,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-04-25T17:34:31.793+0000)
>
> Which sounds do you mean?  Like the bell noises when mousing over champions in your collection?  You can disable this by muting or unchecking "Enable SFX" in your client settings, under the sound panel.  Let me know if that helps.

This does NOT help. It turns off queue noise in addition.

Ideally there's some setup to only hear:

Queue popup, 10 second timer in champ select, game invites, whispers/messages. 
(and maybe when someone joins the party)
Aka: notifications. Without all the miscellaneous flair/ui noises.


Also, how did no one at riot realize that the third checkbox for sound is redundant? If you have the "enable sfx" and "enable music" unchecked there's literally no sound already...

And what inspired the inability to access friends list while in champion select??

> [{quoted}](name=Rineyy,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=jJrAfj8t,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-04-25T05:52:07.569+0000)
>
> You can't.

Then why am i forced into this garbage? How do i restore the legacy client?
